page.title: 03Local History Park Howard
page.content: {December 1911}Llanelli U.D.C showed interest in purchasing Bryncaerau grounds and castle,to turn it into a public park.{4.January 1912},Sir Stafford and Lady Howard purchased the castle and its grounds,for Â£7,750 and leased it to the Council for 999 years at an annual rent of Â£5.{21 September, {1912}Park Howard was opened to the public by Lady Howard.During the First World War,the mansion was used as a hospital for wounded soldiers.{1932} the children's amusement park was opened.{21 September 1937}The opening of the rose garden by Lady Howard Stepney.{29 September 1965}Park Howard and 32 acres of land were purchased by the Borough Council from the Stepney Estate for Â£350,000 {1977}The Queen visited the park during the Silver Jubilee celebrations.
